results.title: Use of beta-blocker types and risk of incident prostate cancer in a multiethnic population.
results.text_hl: Of beta-blocker types, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ alone was associated with a 38% reduction in odds of incident @<m>DISEASE_Cap_Myopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C579969 @@@CaP@@@ (P= 0.01), with a 40% and 54% reduction in risks of National Comprehensive @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@Cancer@@@ Network intermediate and high-risk @<m>DISEASE_Cap_Myopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C579969 @@@CaP@@@ (P = 0.03 and P = 0.03, respectively) compared to @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ not taking a beta-blocker.

citations.NLM: Zahalka AH, Fram E, Lin W, Mohn L, Frenette PS, Agalliu I, Watts KL. Use of beta-blocker types and risk of incident prostate cancer in a multiethnic population. Urol Oncol. 2020 Oct;38(10):794.e11-794.e16. PMID: 32307329
citations.BibTeX: @article{32307329, title={Use of beta-blocker types and risk of incident prostate cancer in a multiethnic population.}, author={Zahalka AH and Fram E and Lin W and Mohn L and Frenette PS and Agalliu I and Watts KL}, journal={Urol Oncol}, volume={38}, number={10}, pages={794.e11-794.e16}}

results.title: PM-induced cardiac oxidative stress and dysfunction are mediated by autonomic stimulation.
results.text_hl: To investigate the role of the autonomic nervous system in PM-induced oxidative stress, @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were given 5 mg/kg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (beta-1 receptor antagonist), 0.30 mg/kg @CHEMICAL_Glycopyrrolate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006024 @@@glycopyrrolate@@@ (muscarinic receptor antagonist) or saline immediately before exposure to @<m>DISEASE_Cap_Myopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C579969 @@@CAPs@@@ aerosols.

citations.NLM: Rhoden CR, Wellenius GA, Ghelfi E, Lawrence J, González-Flecha B. PM-induced cardiac oxidative stress and dysfunction are mediated by autonomic stimulation. Biochim Biophys Acta. 2005 Oct 10;1725(3):305-13. PMID: 16005153
citations.BibTeX: @article{16005153, title={PM-induced cardiac oxidative stress and dysfunction are mediated by autonomic stimulation.}, author={Rhoden CR and Wellenius GA and Ghelfi E and Lawrence J and González-Flecha B}, journal={Biochim Biophys Acta}, volume={1725}, number={3}, pages={305-13}}
